## Creating Vectors

The ```c()``` function can be used to create vectors of objects.

```{r}
x <- c(0.5, 0.6)       ## numeric
x <- c(TRUE, FALSE)    ## logical
x <- c(T, F)           ## logical
x <- c("a", "b", "c")  ## character
x <- 9:29              ## integer
x <- c(1+0i, 2+4i)       ## complex
```

Using the ```vector()``` function:
```{r}
x <- vector("numeric", length = 10) #for numeric vectors the    default value is zero.
print(x)
```

### Mixing objects

When different objects are mixed in a vector, *coercion* occurs so that every element in the vector if of the same class.

```{r}
y <- c(1.7, "a")   ## character
y <- c(TRUE, 2)    ## numeric
y <- c("a", TRUE)  ##character
```
